title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Optimal Control Design for Wastewater Treatment Processes

context.prior_knowledge: Control Theory, Machine Learning Fundamentals, and Basic Principles of Wastewater Treatment Processes
context.additional_context: Blended learning combining hands-on practice with digital devices (laptops/tablets) and theoretical lectures, with continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: They can explain the implementation procedure of reinforcement learning-based control algorithms in nonlinear discrete-time system modeling
They can design control policies that minimize cost functions in wastewater treatment processes using Q-learning
They can practice balancing learning speed and stability through weight adjustments between prior and exploration policies
They can implement online Q-learning algorithms based on real-time wastewater treatment data and evaluate performance
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
